sentence.Network_en: He is equerry to the Prince of Wales.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是威尔士亲王的侍从.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (formerly also as esquiry): from Old French esquierie 'company of squires, prince's stables', from Old French esquier 'esquire', perhaps associated with Latin equus 'horse'. The historical sense is apparently based on Old French esquier d'esquierie 'squire of stables'

entry.def: An equerry is an officer of a royal household or court who acts as a personal assistant to a member of the royal family.

means.word_mean: 1. an official charged with the care of the horses of princes or nobles
2. a personal attendant of the British royal family

auth_sentence.content: He then spent a year as an equerry to the Duke of Gloucester.
